I wish Marathon had a single player or co-op campaign. The original games are great experiences and it'd be cool to see a modern marathon campaign with the same esoteric and mindbending writing, lore, and level design. I'm not entirely opposed to extraction shooter Marathon, but I still think that having a good campaign is much, much more valuable to a game these days.

"We were going to play both regardless." I really doubt this. One of the biggest complaints about Marathon before and during the alpha was that it was an extraction shooter, and everyone was saying they didn't want that. I doubt many people were saying "I hate extraction shooters... except for that one that I didn't even know existed until a week after marathon blew its alpha." The idea that the community was planning on giving Arc Raiders a shot previously is ridiculous. Most of them didn't even know the game existed, and were loudly against extraction shooters. Same with most streamers.
Marathon HEAVILY improved. Having more fun playing marathon rn than i did arc raiders last week personally.

What I can't believe is how a whole ass company like Bungie (who is in the business of making money) has been hearing feedback about how bad it's customers or should I say player base, want a D3 and how easy it would be to sell and make money off of it. It's like me owning a burger restaurant, and my customers asking me if I could throw an extra Patty and some more veggies in the burger and I'm like. Nah. Here's a hot dog. I'll say this. I absolutely loved the ARG Puzzle marketing idea Marathon did. And I do think it created a hype around it but considering what all occurred and especially how the official responses were, created a void of wanting a extraction shooter which got filled with ARC Raiders. I do believe it did help ARC Raiders catch even more traction. which it absolutely would have without but a certain extra push did occur. I think Bungie could have done a much better job on how to handle the incidents. But I also agree with you here that it is probably for the better that Marathon now got pushed back to inevitably get more polish, more focus and maybe even learn something from what people love so much about ARC Raiders. I'm not gonna keep a grudge against Bungie here, I'm sure the assets being stolen really comes down to a handful of people rather than the whole company. Personally I do wish they can turn it around and I hope the competition it has now clearly with ARC Raiders helps them get back on track on fulfilling what gamers are asking for.
